item.title: Freer Monads, More Extensible Effects
item.description: 1. Derivation of Free-er Monad 1.1 Reader Effect Reader computations depend on a value supplied by the environment/context. A side-effect can be understood as an interaction of an expression with its context. The possible requests of a Reader can be specified as a data type. data It i a = Pure a | Get (i -> It i a) The expression Pure e marks the computation e that makes no requests, silently working towards a value of the type a.
